attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: The Goddess of Battle protects Her own.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Myrmidia, if not a member outright. Myrmidia is an ascended mortal and the chief deity in the south, and the vast influence of her cults teach tactical acumen, mercy, and civilization.

effects.description: Replenishes 10% campaign movement range after winning a battle

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of Nahmud, if not a member outright. Although part of the vaster Myrmidian cults, the various sects of Nahmud favour equality and special education, and are somewhat too fond of secrecy.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of Sister Fury, if not a member outright. One of Myrmidia's companions in life, Fury's legacy is one of intense, violent, but controlled rage and violence against injustice and destruction.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Solkan, if not a member outright. The merciless god is one of the most ancient, and just as timeless is his unbridled retribution against the corrupted. His is currently a relatively awkward presence, strongest in Remas.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Morr, if not a member outright. The old god of the dead's legacy is one of fatalism and certainty, and finds its largest seat in Luccini.

effects.description:
Battle healing cap: -10%
	(enemy armies in local region)
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Vampire Counts, Vampire Coast and Tomb Kings

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Shallya, if not a member outright. Her teachings of healing and compassion feel at odds with the world's grimness and darkness, which is also why many flock to her.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +5%
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the goddess Verena, if not a member outright. Like her husband Morr, the blind deity's legacy is not only one of learning and justice, but also one of detached impartiality.

By a combination of inclination, faith and training, this character is aligned with the cults of the god Ranald, if not a member outright. He is one of many and sometimes darker aspects, but the lord of fortune was also the only one who could make Morr smile. Somewhat.

ui_effects.localised_text: Grants one of the listed effects at random

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Well, this is straightforward enough.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +2 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Oh wait, there's another chapter.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +2 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the lousiest commander knows that you need two halves of a pair of scissors.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +3 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Duck! Shoot! Duck! Shoot! Shoot- shoot, that was wrong.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +3% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +6% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +10% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The key is not letting your initiative depend on a lucky die.
It's seldom enough to have only some of your troops to be ready to take a beating. The enemy has their own plans.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +3% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +3 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "You kill them before they kill you, sonnie. That's all it is."

effects.description:
Melee attack: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Though of course, if they do stab you, you better know how to parry."

effects.description:
Melee defence: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Plus, you better kill them dead with the one shot you have."

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "And to do that, it helps if you put all your weight where it counts."

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +2% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Look, at the end of the day, you may be alive and you better learn from what didn't kill you."

effects.description:
Physical resistance: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A regal air? Let's see how long that lasts.

effects.description:
Chance to gain a magic item: 5% per turn
	(factionwide)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "The smallfolk should be thankful - without us, who would they work for?"

effects.description:
Construction time: -25% for all buildings
	(local region)

Melee attack: +4 for all units (Rank 7 and above)
	(own army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Franz has put his trust in this man; pray he does not let him down!

related_attributes.bullet_text:
When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The thrill of the chase, the tremor as the quarry is cornered, the ecstasy of the kill. These are the things that matter.

related_attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit causes additional damage when attacking charging enemies.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty
Immune to diplomatic penalties from trespassing
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +2 for all units
	(Lord's army)

nodes.localised_description: With roots and allies among the most powerful and upright nobility, this Lord doesn't often meddle with unstable mercs. Who heard that.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +3 for all heavy cavalry and other aristocratic units
	(Lord's army)

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +2 for all heavy cavalry and other aristocratic units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for all heavy cavalry and other aristocratic units
	(Lord's army)

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 for all heavy cavalry and other aristocratic units
	(Lord's army)

nodes.localised_description: Perhaps risen from the lowest ranks, this commander is in his own environment when leading mercenary companies, just as a dolphin plays on the waves.
Tileans are an odd bunch, known to fight to the last for the most disparate reasons: their ideals, their captain, their regiment, their purse, a painting.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Broken Lances, Noble Retinue and Knights Encarmine (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Pikemen and Half Pikes (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for all crossbow units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +5% for Pikemen, Half Pikes, Broken Lances, Noble Retinue, Knights Encarmine and all crossbow units
	(Lord's army)

nodes.localised_description: Perhaps risen from the lowest ranks, this commander is in his own environment when leading mercenary companies, just as a dolphin plays on the waves.

A commoner was once asked by a foreign recruiter about a band of Estalian mercenaries. Shrugging, he replied that they were "evil men", which was misunderstood as being 'local' for tough troops. Like many mistranslations, it stuck.

Tileans are an odd bunch, known to fight to the last for the most disparate reasons: their ideals, their captain, their regiment, their purse, a painting.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Broken Lances, Noble Retinue and Knights Encarmine (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Pikemen and Half Pikes (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for all crossbow units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +5% for Pikemen, Half Pikes, Broken Lances, Noble Retinue, Knights Encarmine and all crossbow units
	(Lord's army)
effects.icon: BUGGED FOR XP UNIT SETS, HAPPENS BY DEFAULT, INTENDED

nodes.localised_description: With roots and allies among the most powerful and upright nobility, this Lord doesn't often meddle with unstable mercs. Who heard that.

nodes.localised_description: Master of one of those small domains that make the Border Princes, this Lord can rely on his citizens and local supporters.

effects.description:
Melee attack and Melee defence: +2 for Freelance Knights, Carlsson Militia and Uvetovsk Kossars units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +2 for Militia Spearmen, Militia Archers, Half Pikes and Billmen
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment and Upkeep cost: -5% for Freelance Knights, Carlsson Militia, Uvetovsk Kossars and Shieldbearers units
	(Lord's army)

Global recruitment duration: -1 for Freelance Knights
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack and Melee defence: +4 for Freelance Knights, Carlsson Militia and Uvetovsk Kossars units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Militia Spearmen, Militia Archers, Half Pikes and Billmen
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment and Upkeep cost: -10% for Freelance Knights, Carlsson Militia, Uvetovsk Kossars and Shieldbearers units
	(Lord's army)

Global recruitment duration: -1 for Freelance Knights
	(Lord's army)

nodes.localised_description: Well-used to fierce struggles against countless invaders, this Lord has earned the trust of the Rangers.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 for Border Rangers, Enforcers and Light Scouts units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment and Upkeep cost: -10% for Border Rangers, Enforcers and Light Scouts units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +8 for Border Rangers, Enforcers and Light Scouts units
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment and Upkeep cost: -20% for Border Rangers, Enforcers and Light Scouts units
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Immune to psychology for Border Rangers, Enforcers and Light Scouts
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

nodes.localised_description: Don't ask them about living on the edge. Or huge green things with teeth.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: +5% for all units (Rank 4 and above)
	(Lord's army)

nodes.localised_description: A commoner was once asked by a foreign recruiter about a band of Estalian mercenaries. Shrugging, he replied that they were "evil men", which was misunderstood as being 'local' for tough troops. Like many mistranslations, it stuck.
